00017 #ifndef BOOST_MPL_AUX_APPLY_HPP_INCLUDED
00018 #define BOOST_MPL_AUX_APPLY_HPP_INCLUDED
00019 
00020 #include "boost/mpl/aux_/config/dtp.hpp"
00021 #include "boost/config.hpp"
00022 
00023 #define BOOST_MPL_AUX_APPLY(arity, args) \
00024     BOOST_PP_CAT(BOOST_MPL_AUX_APPLY,arity) args \
00025 
00026 
00027 // agurt, 14/nov/02: temporary fix, need to research a couple of ICEs to
00028 // get rid of this mess
00029 #if defined(BOOST_MSVC) && BOOST_MSVC == 1300 && !defined(BOOST_MPL_PREPROCESSING_MODE)
00030 #   include "boost/mpl/apply.hpp"
00031 #endif
00032 
00033 #if defined(BOOST_MPL_USE_APPLY_INTERNALLY) \
00034     || defined(BOOST_BROKEN_DEFAULT_TEMPLATE_PARAMETERS_IN_NESTED_TEMPLATES) \
00035     || defined(BOOST_MSVC) && (BOOST_MSVC < 1300 || BOOST_MSVC == 1300 && defined(BOOST_MPL_PREPROCESSING_MODE))
00036 
00037 #   if !defined(BOOST_MPL_PREPROCESSING_MODE)
00038 #       include "boost/mpl/apply.hpp"
00039 #   endif
00040 
00041 // tokenization takes place before macro expansion (see 2.1 [lex.phases] 
00042 // para 3-4), so, strictly speaking, spaces between '<', 'f', and '>' tokens 
00043 // below (BOOST_MPL_AUX_APPLY0) are not required; they are needed in practice, 
00044 // though, because there is at least one compiler (MSVC 6.5) that does not 
00045 // conform to the standard here
00046 #   define BOOST_MPL_AUX_APPLY0(f) apply0< f >
00047 #   define BOOST_MPL_AUX_APPLY1(f,a1) apply1<f,a1>
00048 #   define BOOST_MPL_AUX_APPLY2(f,a1,a2) apply2<f,a1,a2>
00049 #   define BOOST_MPL_AUX_APPLY3(f,a1,a2,a3) apply3<f,a1,a2,a3>
00050 #   define BOOST_MPL_AUX_APPLY4(f,a1,a2,a3,a4) apply4<f,a1,a2,a3,a4>
00051 #   define BOOST_MPL_AUX_APPLY5(f,a1,a2,a3,a4,a5) apply5<f,a1,a2,a3,a4,a5>
00052 #   define BOOST_MPL_AUX_APPLY6(f,a1,a2,a3,a4,a5,a6) apply6<f,a1,a2,a3,a4,a5,a6>
00053 #   define BOOST_MPL_AUX_APPLY7(f,a1,a2,a3,a4,a5,a6,a7) apply7<f,a1,a2,a3,a4,a5,a6,a7>
00054 #   define BOOST_MPL_AUX_APPLY8(f,a1,a2,a3,a4,a5,a6,a7,a8) apply8<f,a1,a2,a3,a4,a5,a6,a7,a8>
00055 #   define BOOST_MPL_AUX_APPLY9(f,a1,a2,a3,a4,a5,a6,a7,a8,a9) apply9<f,a1,a2,a3,a4,a5,a6,a7,a8,a9>
00056 
00057 #else
00058 
00059 #   define BOOST_MPL_AUX_APPLY0(f) f
00060 #   define BOOST_MPL_AUX_APPLY1(f,a1) f::template apply<a1>
00061 #   define BOOST_MPL_AUX_APPLY2(f,a1,a2) f::template apply<a1,a2>
00062 #   define BOOST_MPL_AUX_APPLY3(f,a1,a2,a3) f::template apply<a1,a2,a3>
00063 #   define BOOST_MPL_AUX_APPLY4(f,a1,a2,a3,a4) f::template apply<a1,a2,a3,a4>
00064 #   define BOOST_MPL_AUX_APPLY5(f,a1,a2,a3,a4,a5) f::template apply<a1,a2,a3,a4,a5>
00065 #   define BOOST_MPL_AUX_APPLY6(f,a1,a2,a3,a4,a5,a6) f::template apply<a1,a2,a3,a4,a5,a6>
00066 #   define BOOST_MPL_AUX_APPLY7(f,a1,a2,a3,a4,a5,a6,a7) f::template apply<a1,a2,a3,a4,a5,a6,a7>
00067 #   define BOOST_MPL_AUX_APPLY8(f,a1,a2,a3,a4,a5,a6,a7,a8) f::template apply<a1,a2,a3,a4,a5,a6,a7,a8>
00068 #   define BOOST_MPL_AUX_APPLY9(f,a1,a2,a3,a4,a5,a6,a7,a8,a9) f::template apply<a1,a2,a3,a4,a5,a6,a7,a8,a9>
00069 
00070 #endif
